abstract: Stock futures had indicated a precipitous drop before the opening bell, but the actual declines, while large, did not amount to an uncontrolled selling frenzy.
snippet: Stock futures had indicated a precipitous drop before the opening bell, but the actual declines, while large, did not amount to an uncontrolled selling frenzy.
lead_paragraph: As on so many other days in recent weeks, traders and analysts on Wall Street arrived at work Friday morning fearing the worst. This time, however, the worst did not come to pass.

headline.main: U.S. Stocks Slide After Rout Overseas
headline.print_headline: U.S. Stocks Slide After Rout Overseas

byline.original: By Vikas Bajaj and Michael M. Grynbaum

abstract: Bank of America plans to offer bonuses to Merrill Lynch brokers that could amount to as much as 100 percent of the annual revenue they generate, in an effort to keep them from defecting after it completes its takeover of the investment firm, Bloomberg News reports, citing people briefed on the plan.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America plans to offer bonuses to Merrill Lynch brokers that could amount to as much as 100 percent of the annual revenue they generate, in an effort to keep them from defecting after it completes its takeover of the investment firm, Bloomberg News reports, citing people briefed on the plan.

headline.main: Merrill Brokers May Get Big Bonuses to Stay
